name: General Knowledge 104 Quiz | Mixed 25 Questions | 25 Questions

questions.text: Who invented the compact disc?
questions.explanation:
James T Russell.

	James Wright invented silly putty, Garnet Carter mini-golf, and Stanley Mason invented the squeeze sauce bottle.

questions.text: Humans can contract how many different diseases from dogs?
In what city was Jimi Hendrix born?
questions.explanation:
Seattle.

	A left handed 'genius' he was born in Seattle on the 27th of November 1942.

questions.text: What is the largest lizard in the world?
How many points are there on a Maltese cross?
Sir Isaac Vivian Alexander Richards is better known as which cricketing great?
questions.explanation:
Viv Richards.

	Viv Richards was born in 1952 in Antigua, and made his test debut for the West Indies in 1974/75 vs India. He retired from international cricket in 1991, and from first-class cricket in 1993, and was selected as one of five Wisden cricketers of the century in 2000.

questions.text: A food organization measures what food eaten by Americans in acres?
The femur is a bone in what part of the body?
You can get a suntan on the palms of your hands.
Smallpox was declared to have been eradicated in what year?
questions.explanation:
1980.

	It had killed nearly 300 million people in the 20th century.

questions.text: Of the following, which was the largest company, in terms of employees, at the turn of the 21st century?
questions.explanation:
Indian railway network.

	Employed 1.6 million people.

questions.text: Dave Grohl the lead singer of the Foo Fighters, was once the drummer for which other famous band, that is no longer together?
The Border collie (dog) originated between the borders of which two countries in the 1500's?
The 'Ashes series' is played between what two cricketing nations?
Marantz manufactures what?
questions.explanation:
Stereo Equipment.

	I have one that nearly as old as I am (23) and it is still a great sound system (very Loud).

questions.text: What civilization is believed to be the first to have harvested the cacao tree, used in modern times to make chocolate products?
Where is the Mutter Museum?
There are more Indian restaurants in the U.K. city of Bradford than there are in Calcutta?
Which poet penned 'Isabella'?
What is the size of the average hockey rink?
What is the largest university in the world (population-wise as at 2001)?
questions.explanation:
University of Paris.

	310 000 students attend the Paris university.

questions.text: A 'Hills Hoist' is a ?
questions.explanation:
Clothesline.

	First patented in 1956, the Hills hoist was invented by a ex-digger Lance Hill. It differed to American designs because of the unique winding mechanism that allowed you to raise or lower the height.

questions.text: The James Bond film 'You only Live Twice' was released in what year?
questions.explanation:
1967.

	Sean Connery bond films are my favourite along with Richard Roundtree Shaft movies.

questions.text: Prior to 2001 what is the only year the Socceroos (Australian soccer team) made it to the soccer world cup finals?
In what country was the first computer built?
questions.explanation:
England.

	Built in the U.K. in 1948 and nicknamed 'Baby', it was over 2m high and 5m long, baby had only 128 bytes of memory. In 1946 the Americans thought they had built the first computer called the Electronic Numerical Intergrator and Communicator, which was used to calculate trajectory for shells in World War Two, but could not be classed as a computer because it had no memory.
